task_summary: Robot opens the oven door by approaching, grasping, and pulling it. The sequence uses direct perception and actuation based on frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode focuses on a robot arm interacting with a kitchen oven. The robot is tasked to open the oven door, which is located beneath the counter shelf. The procedure involves perceiving and localizing the oven door, positioning the end effector, planning and executing a grasp using a 'pull' strategy, actuating the opening movement, verifying the door's open state, and retreating safely. The robot relies on visual feedback and action primitives constrained by pre-set timeouts and distances. Object location and pose must be stable; ambient clutter is minimal.
preconditions: Oven door is closed and reachable
Robot arm initialized and not holding any object
stepwise_plan: Approach and align gripper to oven door
Compute and execute grasp using pull strategy
Actuate a pulling movement to open door
Verify the oven door is open
success_criteria: Oven door visibly open after action
No collision or damage to robot or environment
failure_and_recovery: Grasp fails: re-plan grasp pose and retry
Actuation stalls: increase pull force or adjust trajectory
task_long_description.termination: Task ends either when oven door is confirmed open or after fixed retries/timeout.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if oven door is visible in the scene
Attempts to localize oven door by visual perception
Brings the gripper into alignment with oven door
Plans a grasp pose for opening the oven door
Executes the grasp at the planned pose using a pull strategy
Pulls the oven door open along a set distance and direction
Checks if oven door is in open state
Moves the arm back after successful opening

recovery_strategy: Retry perception if oven door not visible
Recompute grasp pose if grasp fails
Repeat pull action with adjusted parameters if actuation fails
assumptions: Frames show direct evidence of target (oven door); no grasp force specified in instruction
No handle type shownâ€”'pull' strategy assumed due to visible grasp and pulling motion
Oven door location and opening direction inferred visually as no explicit port values present in instruction
Timeouts and tolerances set to robust bins based on frame transitions

expected_success_criteria: Oven door visibly open and stable at episode end
No damage to robot or kitchen environment
